p: Most of the genus Thymus species are medical, aromatic, essential oil containing plants, which are used as a flavor or fragrance ingredients in food industry. Therefore, thyme essential oils have antimicrobial properties and can be used not only as spices but also as food preservatives [ 11]. Chemical polymorphism is characteristic for Thymus different individuals of the same species, which can synthesize different chemical composition essential oils. As a result, several chemotypes can be defined and one of them is α-TA chemotype [ 12, 13]. Different percentages of α-TA have been found in various Thymus species including large thyme ( Thymus pulegioides) growing wild in Europe ( Table 1).
